intro: Myogalum nutans subsp. prasandrum, commonly known as the nodding myogalum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its drooping inflorescences and delicate, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the stems are slender and branching. The subspecies prasandrum is distinguished by its unique floral structure and habitat preferences compared to other subspecies of Myogalum nutans.
